doc.title: Football quiz: Sepp Blatter or Silvio Berlusconi?
doc.author: Tom Bryant
doc.description: Can you tell the difference between quotes from the head of Fifa and the Italian politician?

main.p: This article is more than 10 years oldFootball quiz: Sepp Blatter or Silvio Berlusconi?This article is more than 10 years oldWho said it – the head of Fifa or the Italian politician? Said & Done: Fifa's 'robust' process1."We have a responsibility to act according to the good governance principles of transparency and zero tolerance towards any wrongdoings."Sepp BlatterSilvio BerlusconiReveal2."There is no one on the world stage who can compete with me."Sepp BlatterSilvio BerlusconiReveal3."I would say [gay people] should refrain from any sexual activities."Sepp BlatterSilvio BerlusconiReveal4."[The pope] asked me to give hope to the poor … We cannot do everything, but we will do what we can."Sepp BlatterSilvio BerlusconiReveal5.“We have seen what the British said … There’s a great deal of discrimination and racism, and this hurts me. Sepp BlatterSilvio BerlusconiReveal7."People criticised us for years … [But now] I am very happy that we have one full [female] member and co-opted another two. I have houses all over the world, stupendous boats... beautiful airplanes, a beautiful wife, a beautiful family... I am making a sacrifice."
